content.description: After the second bolt you transition to the left side of the climb over to some small ridges fun and slabby.
content.location: When you park at Cox Canyon west it should be right in front of you.

content.description: This climb is quite fun. It can be led with trad gear, the first ascent was done with trad gear, but it was very challenging to place any gear because of the way the chimney is, so we bolted it. The sandstone quality isn't too bad.
content.location: from the parking lot, head towards the cliff, the route is to the right about 100 yards or so. there is a small boulder field just before the climb. If you wish to set a toprope, head to the left, where you can get to the level above the cliff easily, then walk along the top, it helps to have already seen it from the bottom, so you know what you're looking for from the top.

content.description: This is an area full of very interesting rock formations. The rocks are full of different textures of very hard grippy sandstone. There are plenty of large boulderfeilds that can make navigation hard. I hope to see more routes here and maybe some boulders in the future.
